comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content:
Gerald Peter Layton ORR.  Son of Robert Gordon and Nell ORR (married in 1865) and the youngest of 5 children (Eleanor (b 1866); Katharine; Edward; Margaret; and Gerald).  He was an officer in the 3rd Volunteer Battalion of The Bedfordshire Regiment - shown in the London Gazette promoted from 2Lt to Lt on 16th September 1905.  Nearly all the officers in the 3rd Volunteers became officers in 5th Battalion Bedfordshire Regiment on 1st April 1908.
Lt G P L ORR was promoted to Temporary Captain wef 17th September 1914.  He was appointed Battalion Adjutant wef 20th May 1915 and promoted to Temporary Major (but remained the Adjutant) wef 5th November 1915.
In the Second World War, Major G P L ORR volunteered for the Auxiliary Military Pioneer Corps as a Lieutenant (No 119448 on 26th August 1940).

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Having been a Territorial officer, (training once a month with a 2 week summer camp) Captain, later Major, GPL Orr principally served in in 3rd/5th Battalion Bedfordshire Regiment. This battalion was raised to recruit, muster and train replacements when 1st/5th Battalion went to Gallipoli in July 1915. The 3rd/5th Battalion was commanded by Lt Col Orlebar and was stationed variously at Bedford, Tring, Crowborough, St Leonards and Hastings. Additional detail at www.bedfordregiment.org.uk/5thbn/5thbattalion.html There is a card for Captain G P L Orr BEDFORDSHIRE in the National Archive Medal Card Index that shows he eventually went on active operations to the Salonika theatre, arriving on 28th April 1918. There is no indication as to the capacity in which he was serving there. //

comment.author: 72133717@N05
comment._content: According to the 1911 Census Gerald Orr was living at 29 Cavendish Road West, London NW. His occupation was an estate agent and he had been born in Highbury, Middlesex in 1884. He was living with his father and mother, Robert G & Eleanor Orr and his sister Margaret Orr. There vwas also a retired Captain from The Royal Engineers and 3 servants living in the house.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Gerald Peter Layton Orr died in Bedford in 1960.//
